name: Distracted Boyfriend
description: Stock photo of a man checking out another woman while his girlfriend looks annoyed.
cultural_context: Used to depict shifting loyalty or attention, especially in consumer or pop culture trends.
interpretation: Highlights a sudden change in preference despite existing commitments.

name: This Is Fine
description: Cartoon dog calmly sitting in a burning room from KC Green's comic.
cultural_context: Represents denial or forced positivity amid obvious crisis.
interpretation: Signals that someone is pretending things are okay while chaos unfolds.

name: Woman Yelling at Cat
description: Split image of a Real Housewives cast member yelling and a smug cat at a dinner table.
cultural_context: Contrasts dramatic outrage with blasé indifference.
interpretation: Used when someone delivers a passionate rant that meets an unfazed response.

name: Galaxy Brain
description: Escalating images of brains lighting up to represent increasingly absurd ideas.
cultural_context: Satirizes convoluted logic framed as genius.
interpretation: Calls out overthinking or contrarian takes posed as brilliant insights.

name: Drake Hotline Bling
description: Two-panel image of Drake rejecting one option and approving another.
interpretation: Visual yes/no list with a casual, humorous tone.

name: Surprised Pikachu
description: Frame of Pikachu from the Pokémon anime with a shocked face.
cultural_context: Used when outcomes were predictable but people act surprised.
interpretation: Mocking feigned shock at foreseeable consequences.

name: Expanding Brain
description: Series of brain images glowing more brightly to suggest increasing intelligence.
cultural_context: Often inverted to mock people who think contrarian takes are smart.
interpretation: Highlights the absurdity of justifying a bad idea as enlightened.

name: Two Buttons
description: Cartoon of a person sweating while choosing between two red buttons.
cultural_context: Represents a difficult choice where both options are bad or revealing.
interpretation: Points out indecision or hypocrisy when someone wants both outcomes.

name: Arthur Fist
description: Close-up of the clenched fist from the Arthur cartoon.
cultural_context: Symbolizes quiet anger or frustration being held back.
interpretation: Signals brewing irritation despite a calm exterior.

name: Is This a Pigeon?
description: Anime character mistakes a butterfly for a pigeon.
cultural_context: Used when someone misidentifies or mislabels something confidently.
interpretation: Calls out bad takes delivered with overconfidence.
